info.title: AgreementRiskInfo API
info.description: ODH Data Retrieval API to support AgreementRiskInfo and Deep Link API

get.summary: Return AgreementRiskInfo for corresponding policy, quote or ODHReferenceID.
get.description: Returns the AgreementRiskInfo object or a subset of properties for the corresponding policy, quote or ODHReferenceID. Actual data returned is dependent on the Views parameter. Depending on the target AgreementRiskInfo's agreement type, the set of required key parameters will be either [PolicyNumber, PolicyTerm and PolicyTransactionID] (for policy) or [NBLogID, BranchCode and RegistrationPolicyTypeCode] (for quote). Alternatively, the ODHReferenceID parameter can be passed to directly find the corresponding AgreementRiskInfo.

parameters.name: RqUID
parameters.description: Every transaction needs unique GUID Request Identifier ex. f81d4fae-7dec-11d0-a765-00a0c91e6bf6

parameters.name: RequestorSystemCd
parameters.description: RequestorSystemCd * 01 - PLUS * 02 - CLAS * 03 - CLAIMS * 04 - CRM * 05 - DCP * 06 - CSS Desktop * 07 - CSS Mobile * 08  - CXD CIP

parameters.name: ODHReferenceID
parameters.description: The ODHReferenceID corresponding to the required AgreementRiskInfo document

parameters.name: View
parameters.description: The view of the AgreementRiskInfo document data to return. The default of all will return the entire AgreementRiskInfo document. agreement will return the corresponding agreement (policy or quote) and its key fields. organisation will return the organization (company) information. vehicles will return the organization's vehicles related to the agreement. locations will return the organization's locations related to the agreement. The special view deeplink will return a response containing the full URL that can be used to create the link on the CLAS UI.

200.description: Successful Operation. The service will return a response of type application/json with a JSON object that includes the requested information.

204.description: Successful Operation but No Data to Return. The search was successfully called but no document corresponding to the supplied key fields was found in the database.

400.description: Bad Request. The combination of passed parameters was either improper or incomplete. The minimum parameters required are the IIB-ODH interoperability parameters and one of the key parameter sets. An incomplete parameter set will cause this error if, for example, PolicyNumber and PolicyTerm are passed but PolicyTransactionID is omitted.

401.description: Unauthorized User. The credentials used to connect to the endpoint are not authorized to perform the requested operation.

404.description: Resource Not Found. An endpoint corresponding to the passed path was not found.

405.description: Method/Operation Unavailable. The initial version of this API only supports the HTTP GET operation. Any other method (PUT, POST, DELETE etc.) will cause this response.

500.description: Internal Server Error. The MarkLogic server has encountered an error. This will usually be related to a bug in the endpoint code. If a caller receives this response, a high-severity issue should be raised.

503.description: Service Unavailable. The endpoint exists but is not currently available, possibly due to maintenance.
